H0.text: Melting iron ore is not a primary process that changes natural resources into industrial materials in manufacturing.

H1.text: Producing lumber is not a primary process, which are the manufacturing steps that transform natural resources into industrial materials.

H2.text: Molding plastic is not a primary process, because primary processes in manufacturing are the steps that transform natural resources into industrial materials.

H3.text: Crushing rock into gravel is not a primary process, which refers to manufacturing steps that transform natural resources into industrial materials.

A4.text: The transition included going from hand production methods to machines, new chemical manufacturing and iron production processes, the increasing use of steam power and water power, the development of machine tools and the rise of the mechanized factory system.

A5.text: Smelting most prominently takes place in a blast furnace to produce pig iron, which is converted into steel.

A6.text: In the 13th century during the High Middle Ages the blast furnace was introduced by China, which had been using it since as early as 200 b.c during the Qin dynasty.

A7.text: Rough lumber is the raw material for furnitureâ€‘making, and manufacture of other items requiring cutting and shaping.

A8.text: Crushers are used to reduce particle size enough so that the material can be processed into finer particles in a grinder.

A9.text: In 1822, the pumping industries needs for larger cylinders met up with Darby's ability to melt sufficient quantities of pig iron to cast large inexpensive iron cylinders instead of costly brass ones, reducing the cost of cylinders by nine-tenths.

A10.text: Crushed stone is used as a surfacing for roads and driveways, sometimes with tar applied over it.

A11.text: It is estimated that almost half of construction sand and gravel is used as aggregate for concrete.
